newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico scraps duties on Canadian hot-rolled steel.
newsitem.headline: Mexico scraps duties on Canadian hot-rolled steel.

text.p: Mexico's Trade Ministry on Friday announced it would scrap anti-dumping duties on imports from Canada of hot-rolled steel after a North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) ruling against it.
"The compensatory tariff is eliminated on all imports of hot-rolled steel ... originating in Canada," the government's Official Gazette said. It said the new law would take effect as of Saturday.
The ruling followed a decision in June from the NAFTA secretariat, ordering Mexico's Trade Ministry to change its anti-dumping duties against Canadian steel.
The duties touched Canadian steel companies Dofasco Inc, Algoma Steel Inc and Stelco Inc. They filed a complaint with the NAFTA panel in February 1996 requesting a review of the tariff.
The Mexican Trade Ministry said the hot-rolled steel duties continued to apply to imports from Brazil, Venezuela, Germany, South Korea and the Netherlands.
((-- Tomas de la Rosa, Mexico City newsroom +525 728-7912))
